presets.label: Twilight Exterior - Classic
presets.description: Classic blue-hour twilight conversion for exterior real estate photos. Natural sky gradient, warm interior lights visible through windows.
presets.promptTemplate:
Transform this real estate exterior photograph to capture the beautiful blue hour period approximately 20-30 minutes after sunset. This is a professional real estate twilight conversion for marketing purposes.

The sky should display a natural blue hour gradient - deep, rich blue at the top transitioning smoothly down to soft warm peach and coral tones near the horizon line. This is the cooler, blue-dominant sky of early evening after the sun has set, not the warmer golden hour sky during sunset.

All windows should glow with warm, inviting interior light using soft amber and warm white tones around 2700-3000K. The windows appear naturally lit from inside, showing a gentle welcoming glow but not overly bright or artificially glowing.

The foliage and landscaping should appear as they naturally would in early evening light - darker and more muted than in daylight. Trees and plants display the deeper, less vibrant greens characteristic of dusk. Grass and garden areas match these evening light conditions with reduced saturation and luminosity.

The overall lighting should be soft, diffused, and even across the entire scene. Shadows are subtle and low-contrast, consistent with the gentle ambient light of dusk. There are no harsh directional shadows from overhead sun, and the scene has the reduced overall luminosity that naturally occurs in early evening conditions.

Preserve all architectural details, landscaping elements, and the exact composition of the original photograph. Maintain all structural elements, fences, pathways, and outdoor features exactly as shown. Only work with lighting fixtures that are already visible in the original image - do not add new landscape lighting, decorative elements, or fixtures that weren't there originally.

The final result should be photorealistic and indistinguishable from an actual photograph taken during blue hour by a professional real estate photographer. No stars, lens flares, fantasy elements, or oversaturation.

presets.label: Twilight Exterior - Premium
presets.description: Premium twilight conversion with enhanced drama. Richer sky colors, more prominent window glow, subtle landscape lighting.
presets.promptTemplate: Create a premium twilight real estate photograph from this exterior image. Requirements: 1) Apply a rich, dramatic blue-hour sky with smooth gradient from deep navy blue to warm coral/amber at the horizon line. 2) Illuminate all windows with warm, inviting interior light - varying intensities to suggest occupied, welcoming spaces. 3) Add subtle landscape accent lighting (pathway lights, garden uplighting) if appropriate for the property style. 4) Preserve every architectural detail, texture, and element exactly as shown. 5) Enhance the property's curb appeal through professional twilight lighting. 6) Do not add light fixtures not in the original - only enhance existing lighting. 7) Keep colors natural and balanced - NO oversaturation, NO artificial-looking effects. 8) NO stars, NO lens flares, NO moon, NO fantasy sky elements. 9) Result must be indistinguishable from a real twilight photograph taken by a professional real estate photographer.

presets.label: Twilight Interior - Evening
presets.description: Evening interior with prominent blue-hour sky through windows. Warm lighting, bright and inviting atmosphere.
presets.promptTemplate:
Transform this interior photograph to capture the beautiful evening twilight atmosphere while maintaining the bright, professional real estate photography quality.

Through the windows, display a stunning blue hour sky gradient transitioning from rich medium blue at the top down to soft warm peach and amber tones near the horizon. The windows are a focal point of this twilight conversion - the sky should be clearly visible and beautiful, not dark or black. If the original photograph shows any exterior structures, neighboring buildings, fences, trees, or landscaping through the windows, these elements must remain exactly as they appear in the original - only add the twilight sky gradient above and behind them. The view through the windows should look like the actual exterior at dusk, preserving all existing exterior elements visible through the glass.

The interior should remain bright and well-exposed, maintaining similar luminosity to the daytime photograph. Apply a subtle warm color shift toward neutral-warm tones around 3000-3500K - this should feel closer to natural daylight with slight warmth, not heavily orange or golden hour saturated. Enhance the existing ceiling lights, lamps, and fixtures with a gentle warm glow. The space should feel inviting and well-lit, not dim or moody. Every architectural detail, texture, and furnishing must remain clearly visible.

This is a subtle time-of-day lighting conversion, not a dramatic mood transformation. The result should look like a professionally photographed evening listing photo - clean, bright, and natural with subtle evening ambiance. Avoid heavy color grading and keep the overall look natural and neutral.

Preserve all furniture, decor, layout, and architectural elements exactly as shown. Do not add any new lighting fixtures, decorative elements, or light sources anywhere in the scene. Maintain the photorealistic, professional real estate photography standards with no artificial glow effects, halos, or oversaturated colors.

presets.label: Twilight Interior - Night Subtle
presets.description: Natural twilight interior with visible blue hour sky through windows. Maintains brightness and professional real estate quality.
presets.promptTemplate:
Transform this interior photograph to a natural twilight scene while maintaining the bright, professional real estate photography quality suitable for luxury property marketing.

Through the windows, show a visible and beautiful blue hour sky gradient transitioning from medium-deep blue at the top down to soft warm peach tones near the horizon. The windows should be a key visual feature displaying this twilight sky, not dark, black, or heavily obscured. Critically important: if the original photograph shows any exterior elements through the windows - neighboring buildings, fences, trees, rooflines, or landscaping - these must remain exactly as they appear in the original photograph. Only add the twilight sky gradient above and behind these existing exterior structures. Think of it as changing the time of day for the actual view outside, not inventing a new scene. The view through the windows should look like the real exterior at dusk.

Keep the interior well-lit and bright - this is not a dark or moody shot. Add a subtle warm ambient glow from the ceiling lights, lamps, and fixtures that are already present in the room. The interior should feel inviting and well-photographed with similar brightness to the daytime photograph. Apply a gentle color temperature shift toward neutral-warm tones around 3000-3500K - not heavily orange or saturated. Aim for a natural, clean look with slight warmth. All architectural details, textures, and features must remain clearly visible and well-exposed.

This is a subtle time-of-day lighting shift, not a dramatic transformation. Maintain the bright, airy, professional real estate photography quality. Avoid heavy warm color grading and keep colors neutral and natural. The overall atmosphere should be subtle evening ambiance while staying professional, bright, and natural.

Preserve all furniture, decor, architectural details, and spatial relationships exactly as shown in the original. Do not add any new lighting fixtures, decorative elements, or light sources anywhere. Maintain crisp, clear, professional standards with no artificial glow effects, halos, or oversaturated colors. The final image should look natural, inviting, and professionally photographed.

presets.label: Twilight Exterior - Soft
presets.description: Soft, gentle twilight for properties that need a subtle touch. Pastel sky tones, gentle window glow.
presets.promptTemplate: Apply a soft, gentle twilight effect to this exterior real estate photograph. Requirements: 1) Create a soft pastel twilight sky - gentle blues and soft pink/peach tones, nothing dramatic. 2) Add subtle warm glow to windows - understated and elegant, not bright. 3) Maintain soft, even lighting across the property facade. 4) Preserve all architectural details, landscaping, and composition exactly as shown. 5) Keep the overall mood calm and inviting, not dramatic. 6) Do not add light fixtures not in the original - only enhance existing lighting. 7) Colors should be muted and natural - NO oversaturation, NO vivid colors. 8) NO stars, NO lens flares, NO fantasy elements. 9) Perfect for properties where subtlety is preferred over drama. 10) Result should look like a real photograph taken during soft twilight conditions.

presets.label: Twilight Pool - Luxury
presets.description: Specialized preset for pool/outdoor living areas. Pool lighting, ambient landscape lights, luxury evening feel.
presets.promptTemplate: Transform this pool/outdoor living area photograph into a luxury twilight scene. Requirements: 1) Apply beautiful blue-hour sky with natural gradient. 2) Add realistic pool lighting - subtle underwater glow in cyan/turquoise tones. 3) Include ambient landscape lighting - pathway lights, garden uplights, architectural accent lights as appropriate. 4) If house is visible, add warm interior lighting through windows. 5) Preserve all pool features, furniture, landscaping, and architectural elements exactly. 6) Do not add light fixtures not in the original - only enhance existing lighting. 7) Create an inviting resort-like evening atmosphere. 8) Water reflections should look natural with twilight sky colors. 9) NO oversaturation, NO artificial-looking lights, NO fantasy effects. 10) NO stars, NO lens flares. 11) Result should look like a professional twilight photograph of a luxury property.
